intro: Distictella porphyrotricha, commonly known as the red moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. The plant has a compact structure with short, branching stems and leaf-like structures that are typically appressed to the substrate. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on soil or rock surfaces in temperate regions. Distictella porphyrotricha plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
